view.name: MTA 2025-2044 20-Year Needs Assessment Asset Condition
view.description: The 2025-2044 20-Year Needs Assessment is a broad, comprehensive blueprint that outlines the MTA region's transportation capital needs for the next generation. It provides an extensive, long-term view based upon rigorous data analysis across all the MTA agencies. The MTA developed a three-part plan to for the next 20 years to achieve the transit network New Yorkers deserve. It is based on three fundamental ideas: rebuild the foundation of the system to ensure its survival, improve our network to meet 21st century needs, and expand to support future growth. This dataset includes data on the conditions of most assets in the MTA system.

columns.name: Agency
columns.description: Agency within the MTA (NYCT, MNR, LIRR, MTA PD, B&T).

columns.name: Asset Category
columns.description: The category for the asset component, such as Shops and Yards, Power, or Bridges.

columns.name: Asset
columns.description: The specific asset type within the category, such as MOW Shops. For many asset components, this is the same as Asset Category.

columns.name: Asset Sub-Category/Components
columns.description: The specific asset component, such as HVAC, Weld Car, or Platform Edges.

columns.name: Total
columns.description: The total number of each asset component. For Bridges & Tunnels data, this is N/A.

columns.name: Units
columns.description: The type of unit for each asset component (Each, Miles, Linear Feet, Square Feet, Structure, Systems, Spans, or N/A).

columns.name: Condition Criteria
columns.description: The criteria by which the condition of the asset is described.

cachedContents.largest: Percent with Remaining Life Less Than 6 Years

columns.name: Condition Criteria Percent
columns.description: The percent of each asset component that meets the given criteria.
